meanings.definition: To make or become less extreme or intense.
meanings.sent1: The teacher moderated the volume of the students during the class.
meanings.sent2: The rain moderated to a light drizzle after the storm passed.
meanings.sent3: The spicy chili was moderated with a dollop of sour cream.
meanings.sent4: Her anger moderated to a simmer after she took a deep breath.
meanings.sent5: The therapist helped him moderate his anxiety through relaxation techniques.

meanings.definition: To preside over a discussion or debate.
meanings.sent1: The professor moderated the panel discussion on climate change.
meanings.sent2: She will moderate the town hall meeting next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat moderated the debate between the two dogs by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The judge moderated the courtroom with a firm but fair hand.
meanings.sent5: The referee must moderate the soccer match to ensure fair play.
